com.paypal.selion.platform.html

Class Table

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.paypal.selion.platform.html.AbstractElement
      • com.paypal.selion.platform.html.Table
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Clickable, Hoverable

    public class Table
extends AbstractElement
    This class is the web element Table wrapper

    Keep in mind that table indexes start with row 1, not 0 in XPATH convention. Therefore all methods in this class that reference a row/column index as an argument or return value will treat these values as an index that starts from 1.

      • Table

        public Table(String locator,
             String controlName,
             ParentTraits parent)
        Use this constructor to create a Table contained within a parent. This constructor will also override default controlName for logging purposes. Default controlName would be the element locator.
        Parameters:
        locator - - A String that represents the means to locate this element (could be id/name/xpath/css locator).
        controlName - the control name used for logging
        parent - - A ParentTraits object that represents the parent element for this element.

    • Method Detail

      • getDataStartIndex

        public int getDataStartIndex()
        The row index where the contents of the table's data start.

      • getNumberOfRows

        public int getNumberOfRows()
        Returns the number of rows in a table. This will include the column row if that is the 1st row of the tbody.
        Returns:
        int number of rows

      • getNumberOfColumns

        public int getNumberOfColumns()
        Returns the number of columns in a table. If the table is empty, column count cannot be determined and 0 will be returned.
        Returns:
        int number of columns

      • getRowIndex

        public int getRowIndex(String[] searchKeys)
        Searches all rows from a table for the occurrence of the input search strings and returns the index to the row containing all the search strings. The search will NOT be performed on the column's row(s).

        Usage: 
         String[] search = { "Payment To", "-$7.00 USD" };
 int searchRow = findRowNumber(search);
        Parameters:
        searchKeys - String[] array with as many values as need to identify the row
        Returns:
        int number of first row where all conditions were met
        Negative number indicates that row was not found

      • getValueFromCell

        public String getValueFromCell(int row,
                               int column)
        Finds value of a cell in a table indicated by row and column indices.

        Parameters:
        row - int number of row for cell
        column - int number of column for cell
        Returns:
        String value of cell with row and column. Null if cannot be found.

      • clickLinkInCell

        public void clickLinkInCell(int row,
                            int column)
        Goes to the cell addressed by row and column indices and clicks link in that cell. Performs wait until page would be loaded
        Parameters:
        row - int number of row for cell
        column - int number of column for cell

      • getXPathBase

        public String getXPathBase()
        Generates xPath from element locator and path to the row (<tr> tag)
        Checks if table has <TBODY> tag and adds it to the xPath
        Returns:
        String with beginning of xPath

      • getRowText

        public String getRowText(int rowIndex)
        Returns the single row of a table as a long string of text using the input row index.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - the index to the row which text is about to retrieve.
        Returns:
        rowText a text string represents the single row of a table
